intro: Hieracium lautumiarum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. It produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium lautumiarum is often found in open habitats like meadows and scree slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
